meanings.definition: The quality or state of being renewable.
meanings.sent1: The renewabilities of solar power make it a sustainable energy source.
meanings.sent2: We must consider the renewabilities of our natural resources for future generations.
meanings.sent3: The renewabilities of the forest seemed to wink at the hikers, promising endless beauty.
meanings.sent4: Her optimism had a renewabilities that shone through even the darkest days.
meanings.sent5: The renewabilities of the river's flow reminded him of the cycle of life.

meanings.definition: The ability to be renewed or replenished.
meanings.sent1: Farmers understand the renewabilities of the soil and rotate crops to maintain fertility.
meanings.sent2: The renewabilities of the water cycle ensure a constant supply of fresh water.
meanings.sent3: The renewabilities of his energy seemed to recharge every time he took a break.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a renewabilities that never seemed to run out.
meanings.sent5: The renewabilities of the forest's growth amazed the researchers studying its ecosystem.

meanings.definition: The potential for continued use or existence.
meanings.sent1: The renewabilities of the technology industry drive innovation and progress.
meanings.sent2: We need to focus on the renewabilities of our infrastructure to ensure long-term sustainability.
meanings.sent3: The renewabilities of his jokes kept the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a renewabilities that inspired those around her.
meanings.sent5: The renewabilities of the community's spirit were evident in times of crisis.
